questions.question: We …………………………….. in the afternoon.
questions.description: The present continuous is commonly used to talk about future events which have already been planned or decided.

questions.question: The school …………………………. for the summer vacation on Friday.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about time tabled future events.

questions.question: She ………………………………. probably ............................. in the afternoon.
questions.description: We use the simple future to talk about future events which are not already decided.

questions.question: I think it ………………………………..  later in the day.
questions.description: The simple future is used to predict future.

questions.question: If there is a strike, we ………………………………….. not be able to go.
I ……………………………. this bike if you lower the price.
questions.description: Shall and will are common in offers, threats, promises and announcements of decisions.

questions.question: ……………………………. I help you with the homework?
questions.description: Shall is used with first person pronouns to make offers.

questions.question: …………………………… you help me with the chores?
questions.description: Will is used in polite requests for help.
